==Explanation==
This comic shows an imagined crossover between the film ''{{w|The Fast and the Furious: Tokyo Drift}}'' and video game series ''{{w|Mario Kart}}'', specifically the entry ''{{w|Mario Kart: Double Dash|Mario Kart: Double Dash!!}}''

In ''Tokyo Drift'', the protagonist is trying to break into the underground street racing ring, and finds that the urban environment of Tokyo is far different than the rural American roads he is used to. The Asian street racers soundly beat him until he is able to master {{w|Drifting (motorsport)|drifting}}. (Lines 4 to 8 of the first panel are from the [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=p8HQ2JLlc4E Tokyo Drift trailer].)

In ''Mario Kart'', drifting is a gameplay mechanic. During a proper drift, the kart creates blue sparks, which give a small, temporary "mini-boost" to the speed of the kart.

In the title text, [[Randall]] jokes about comparing a shopping cart to karts from Mario Kart by imagining blue sparks forming whenever he drifts the cart.
